s.text: The Times has the most detail about the U.S. role, reporting that President Clinton insisted in a 20-minute phone call with Suharto on Thursday night that Indonesia must put in place strong economic reforms.
(Presumably they could rule out a really hot date.)

The Times makes it clear that the judge can only recommend sentence conditions, which ultimately are determined by prison officials.
